author: pipermerriam
content: @carver I realized that we need to look at how exploitable the DOS vectors become when most of the actors only have a partial view of the pool. A malicious actor can send N transactions with the same nonce resulting in N transactions that each map randomly onto the key space. Light nodes will gossip them freely, only discarding some  them when the node's radius is large enough to see multiple of them. As they make there way from the edge of the network towards the middle where radius values get larger, more and more will be discarded as the duplicates get detected.

author: pipermerriam
content: It seems like the most impacted nodes would be the lightest edge nodes which doesn't seem to bad at first glance
